main.java.storage

Class Storage

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.java.storage.Storage

  • public class Storage
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles the Storage component and executes the appropriate action requested by the Logic component
    Author:
    Lim Yong Zhi

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int addOneItem(main.java.resources.Task task)
      Adds a task to the internal taskList, writes to external file then sorts the internal taskList.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static Storage getInstance()
        Creates an access to the Storage object and creates one if there is none.
        Returns:
        a newly created storage object for manipulation

      • getTaskList

        public java.util.ArrayList<main.java.resources.Task> getTaskList()
        Creates an access to the internal taskList.
        Returns:
        the internal taskList containing an ArrayList of tasks

      • changeDirectory

        public int changeDirectory(java.lang.String setDirectory)
        Allows user to change the destination of the external file and then writes to the new location. Returns an integer if the process is successful (0) or unsuccessful (-1).
        Parameters:
        setDirectory - a string containing a path in the file system
        Returns:
        an integer containing a success (0) or failure (-1) code

      • regenerateTaskList

        public void regenerateTaskList()
        Reads the external file to regenerate the taskList. If the external file contains a path, the external file shall be read at that location. If not, an empty taskList will be created.

      • addOneItem

        public int addOneItem(main.java.resources.Task task)
        Adds a task to the internal taskList, writes to external file then sorts the internal taskList.
        Parameters:
        task - a task object containing details to a user's task
        Returns:
        an integer containing a success (0) or failure (-1) code

      • deleteOneItem

        public int deleteOneItem(main.java.resources.Task task)
        Deletes a task from the internal taskList, deletes an entry from external file then sorts the internal taskList.
        Parameters:
        task - a task object containing details to a user's task
        Returns:
        an integer containing a success (0) or failure (-1) code

      • completeOneItem

        public int completeOneItem(main.java.resources.Task task)
        Sets a task to complete saved in external file

        Checks to see if the task is complete before setting the task to complete in the internal taskList. After that, it replaces the task stored in the external file before returning a sorted taskList.

        Parameters:
        task - a task object containing details to a user's task
        Returns:
        an integer containing a success (0) or failure (-1) code

      • incompleteOneItem

        public int incompleteOneItem(main.java.resources.Task task)
        Sets a task to incomplete saved in external file

        Checks to see if the task is incomplete before setting the task to incomplete in the internal taskList. After that, it replaces the task stored in the external file before returning a sorted taskList.

        Parameters:
        task - a task object containing details to a user's task
        Returns:
        an integer containing a success (0) or failure (-1) code
